dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Description
dataObjects.title: Description
dataObjects.rightsHolder: Mark Hyde, Bart Wursten and Petra Ballings
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Hyde, M.A., Wursten, B.T. and Ballings, P.  (2002-2014). Ceratopteris thalictroides (L.) Brongn. Flora of Zimbabwe website. Accessed 28 August 2014 at http://www.zimbabweflora.co.zw/speciesdata/species.php?species_id=100680
dataObjects.description: Rhizome erect, short. Fronds tufted, dimorphous. Stipe up to 16 cm long, succulent and brittle when fresh, glabrous. Frond erect to arching, succulent, brittle, dimorphous. Sterile lamina: up to 20 × 7 cm, obovate or narrowly triangular in outline, 2-pinnatifid, often proliferous; ultimate lobes triangular or lanceolate, apex sharply to bluntly pointed, glabrous on both surfaces. Fertile lamina longer and more dissected than sterile frond: up to 40 cm long, narrowly to broadly ovate in outline, usually 3-pinnatifid; ultimate lobes narrowly linear, pointed, up to 40 × 1-1.5 mm, glabrous on both surfaces. Sporangia scattered along the veins; indusium marginal, entire, membranous.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Brief
dataObjects.rightsHolder: India Biodiversity Portal
dataObjects.description: "Red List Category & Criteria: Least Concern ver 3.1  Year Assessed: 2011 Assessor/s: Irudayaraj, V. Reviewer/s: Manju, C.N., Rajesh, K.P., Jeeva, S. & Molur, S. Contributors: Molur, S. Justification: Ceratopteris thalictroides is cosmopolitan in distribution with no threats. It is an aquatic weed, hence of Least Concern. Conservation Actions: No conservation actions are known or needed for this species."

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Distribution
dataObjects.rightsHolder: India Biodiversity Portal
dataObjects.description: "Range Description: Ceratopteris thalictroides is cosmopolitan in distribution occurring widely in Asia, Australia, and America. Countries -  Native: Angola (Angola); Australia; Brazil; Burundi; Cameroon; China (Guangdong, Guangxi); Colombia; Congo, The Democratic Republic of the; Costa Rica; Côte d'Ivoire; Ecuador; El Salvador; Ethiopia; French Guiana; Gabon; Ghana; Guam; Guatemala; Guyana; India (Kerala, Tamil Nadu); Jamaica; Japan (Honshu, Kyushu, Shikoku); Liberia; Madagascar; Mexico; Micronesia, Federated States of; Mozambique; Namibia (Namibia (main part)); Nepal; Nicaragua; Nigeria; Panama; Papua New Guinea; Philippines; Puerto Rico; Senegal; Seychelles; Sierra Leone; Solomon Islands; Somalia; South Africa (KwaZulu-Natal); Sri Lanka; Sudan; Suriname; Swaziland; Tanzania, United Republic of; Thailand; Togo; Uganda; United States (Florida); Venezuela; Viet Nam; Zambia; Zimbabwe"

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.title: Description
dataObjects.rightsHolder: Missouri Botanical Garden, 4344 Shaw Boulevard, St. Louis, MO, 63110 USA
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Flora of North America Vol. 2 in eFloras.org, Missouri Botanical Garden. Accessed Nov 12, 2008.
dataObjects.description: Plants  usually rooted in soil.  Sterile leaves  lanceolate to lance-ovate to ovate to deltate or cordate.  Petiole of sterile leaf  1--31 cm, not inflated.  Blade of sterile leaf  1--3-pinnate, 2--41 × 2--20 cm; segments lobed or incised, elliptic to lanceolate to ovate or deltate, to 12.5 cm; proximal pinnae ± alternate.  Fertile leaves  lanceolate to ovate to deltate or cordate, 2--117 × 2--48 cm.  Petiole of fertile leaf  1--46 cm.  Blade of fertile leaf  3--4-pinnate proximally, 2-pinnate distally; terminal segments linear.  Sporangia  usually crowded between segment midvein and revolute margin, with 13--71 indurate annulus cells.  Spores  32 per sporangium, 96--124 µm diam. 2 n  = 154, 156.

agents.full_name: Flora of North America Editorial Committee

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: General Habitat
dataObjects.rightsHolder: India Biodiversity Portal
dataObjects.description: "Habitat and Ecology: Ceratopteris thalictroides occurs in semi shaded localities mostly rooted in mud, occasionally free floating and common in paddy fields, ponds (Manickam and Irudayaraj 1992, Nair et al. 1992, Nayar and Geevarghese 1993, Mahesh 2010). Systems: Freshwater List of Habitats: 1, 1.6, 15, 15.1, 15.2, 15.8"

dataObjects.description: Aquatic to semiaquatic in swamps, bogs, canals, ponds, lakes, ditches, marshes; 0--200m.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#ConservationStatus
dataObjects.title: NatureServe Conservation Status
dataObjects.rightsHolder: NatureServe
dataObjects.description:
Rounded Global Status Rank: G4 - Apparently Secure

Reasons: Widespread distribution (pantropical), but listed as rare in Jamaica (Proctor, 1985). Naturalized but occasional in Florida and Texas. Abundance in other areas not known.
